content.description: A highly recomended start to Burn Notice that makes for a great problem. This may be a good problem for those uninhibited, grovely-types who don't mind using any body part that works.
content.protection: A small pad stuffed in the hole will help if you pop on the starting moves. Another pad behind and on the wall to the right will add confidence making the toss. Pants are a plus.
content.location: Start sitting in the opening of the cave with right hand on the rail, left on the good block, and feet on the right wall.

content.description: Start with left hand in a good pocket in the seam and right hand on a sloper. Go straight up to the jugs at the lip. Avoid using the rock to the right and left for feet.
content.protection: A pad flat, and another leaning against the rock to the right.
content.location: North side of the boulder at the blackened face.

content.description:
Same start as Burn Notice. Climb up and right, around the sloping feature all the way to the prominent horn-shaped jug on the uphill side and top out. Pants are HIGHLY recommended. May be hard for taller folks to keep their backside from brushing the ground. Be warned that the feet on the latter parts of the problem may disintegrate. All that said its still a very fun pump. 

  The same sit start as BN would probably bump the difficulty to V5
content.protection: A pad covering the rock to the right is advisable. It is possible to drag it along yourself to protect a couple moves around the corner.
content.location: Starts at Burn Notice and traverses right.

content.description: This boulder is located on the hill below the Berry Boulders and north of the Nacho Boulder. It is distinguished by itÂ’s low profile, squared roof on the downhill side. Signs of significant fire damage can be found on several parts. The underneath of the boulder is accessible by crawling in from the north side. Problems start here. A sit start in the opening adds interesting and difficult moves to both problems.
